attributes.gcd: Refers to the date as on which the snapshot of source data extracted for processing.
Refers to the Credit Reason Code.

Refers to the source system from where data is extracted. Data can be sourced from multiple sources, this column will Refers to the source code from where the data is extracted for this extraction date.
Refers to the last assigned date of the rating.

Refers to the minimum coverage percentage for issuance of covered bonds as determined by rating agencies. Multiple rating agencies may determine different coverage percentage for the same issuance. For covered bonds issuance, the Issuer (Party) and the Pool are inextricably linked i.e. the issuer is usually a SPV, which solely exists for the purpose (special purpose) of creation of a particular covered pool and issuance of covered bonds backed by the pool. This makes a Pool and Issuer i.e. Party combination unique. Based on this rationale, this attribute is made available in Stage Party Rating Details which is at a combined grain of Party i.e. Issuer and Rating Source code which is expected to be distinct for different rating agencies.
Refers to the Basel Rating of securities that we receive as collateral. This is expected as Download and is required for QIS and 4G Liquidity asset reclassification.
Flag indicates the initial rating assigned to the party. List of values are Y, N. If Y indicates it is a original rating and a value N indicates that this is the current rating.
Refers to the Date on which the outlook watch indicator has been assigned.
Refers to the unique identifier for the party. Party is defined as an entity or a person who takes part or is involved in an agreement, lawsuit, or transaction.

Refers to the purpose for which the contract or account, loan, lease etc., was entered and approved. Common purposes for loans include Refinancing, Project Finance, Home Improvement, Education, Personal expenses etc. The purposes can vary depending on whether the loan is extended to a corporation or an individual borrower. In case of ratings the purpose of rating whether the rating is DOMESTIC or FOREIGN.
Refers to the code representing the rating of the Instrument or the exposure.
Flag indicates whether rating provided is eligible for Capital Calculation under Basel II guidelines. List of values are Y, N.

Indicates how the rating agency feels that this party might be rated in the next few months. A value of P indicates positive outlook which means that there will be an increase in the credit rating for this party, a value of N indicates negative outlook which means that there will be a decrease in the credit rating of this party and a value of S indicates neutral or same outlook which means that there is a possibility of neither an increase nor a decrease in the rating and the same will be maintained. For EU, this is required as per article 197 section 4 d.
Refers to the code applicable to the Rating Source along with Horizon separated by a space. E.g. FIT L, FIT S.
Refers to the record creation date. It has been added to all catalog entities to enable partitioning and archival.
Refers to the run identifier for a set of Records participating in the particular Run with the Run Execution identifier. This is a combination of Run Main Identifier and Run Execution Identifier.

Flag indicates whether the credit rating is an unsolicited rating or a solicited rating. Unsolicited rating refers to a rating assessment of agency of creditworthiness of a borrower without any involvement of the borrower itself. A value of Y indicates that the credit rating is Unsolicited rating and a value of N indicates that the credit rating is a Solicited rating. List of values are Y, N.
Refers to the reason description of watch list.

governance.dqDesc: Should have list of values as N,P,S
governance.dqType: List of Values or Code Check

governance.dqDesc: Should have list of values as N,Y
